properties-param.name: developerInfo
properties-param.description: The group that is allowed to develop gadgets

component-plugin.name: new.portal.portlets.registry
component-plugin.description: this listener init the portlets are registered in PortletRegister

field.name: description
field.string: A list of portlets used by groundwork

field.name: description
field.string: Groundwork License page for license validation

field.name: description
field.string: What is next portlet. Shortcuts to applications

field.name: description
field.string: Events portlet is an embedded Event Console application which provides an event list for the entire network or for selected host group along with the capability of applying actions (e.g. Accept Log Message, Notify Log Message, Nagios Acknowledge), sorting, and pausing incoming events. This portlet is viewable at the host group, service group, host and service levels in Status Viewer.

field.name: description
field.string: Host Group Health portlet provides quick status for the selected host group’s host and service availability. A color coded status indicator shows the host group's, as a parent node, most critical state.

field.name: description
field.string: Host Group Summary portlet shows monitoring statistics at the Entire Network level with drill-down capability for viewing detailed data. Displayed graphs provide an at-a-glance filtered view of your overall host group status.

field.name: description
field.string: Host Health portlet provides quick status and information for the selected host. A color-coded status indicator shows the current state of selected host. In addition, the time the host has been in the current state, and the number of Groups and Parents for this host - are conveniently listed.

field.name: description
field.string: Host Information portlet shows detailed status and check information. Here you can directly schedule downtime or disable notifications, and schedule or disable checks.

field.name: description
field.string: Host List portlet provides a listing and status of the host group's hosts. Each device name (Host Name) can be selected to drill-down into for more detail, and each host problem can be directly acknowledged.

field.name: description
field.string: Host Summary portlet shows monitoring statistics at the Entire Network and Host Group levels with drill-down capability for viewing detailed data. Displayed graphs provide an at-a-glance filtered view of your overall host status representing segments of host states.

field.name: description
field.string: Monitoring Performance portlet shows the performance monitoring graphs and statistics in form of dial charts. It communicates with “Nagios Performance” JMS topic to show graphs for Service Latency, Execution and Checks. It also displays various statistical data like Active and Passive Service Checks per 1/5/15 minutes.

field.name: description
field.string: Network Service Plugin Portlet shows Groundwork Notifications and Installation Information to the user. “Notification Service” needs to be enabled by administrator in order to display various notifications from groundwork. “Build Installation Information” includes information like Installer Name (build version currently installed), Installation Date, etc.

field.name: description
field.string: Performance Measurement portlet provides RRD graphs for the various host services. Time filters like Today, Last 24 Hours, Last 30 Days etc can be chosen as per the user needs. The integrated performance graphs display time-series data such as; network bandwidth, CPU utilization, machine-room temperature, transaction response times, and server load averages. These graphs are viewable at the host and service levels.

field.name: description
field.string: Service Availability displays color-coded status for a selected service. The name of the service and the colored horizontal bar show this service's availability by status color. The Time selector enables the user to change the present time period for the graph.

field.name: description
field.string: Service Group Health portlet provides quick status for the selected service group’s service availability. A color coded status indicator shows the service group's, as a parent node, most critical state.

field.name: description
field.string: Service Group Summary portlet shows monitoring statistics at the Entire Network level with drill-down capability for viewing detailed data. These graphs provide an at-a-glance filtered view of your overall service group status.

field.name: description
field.string: Service Health portlet provides quick status and information for the selected service. A color-coded status indicator shows the service state along with the time the service has been in the current state. Host and number of Groups associated with this service are also displayed, both of which you can drill-down into for more detailed information.

field.name: description
field.string: Service Status Information portlet shows detailed status and check information for the selected service. Here you can directly schedule downtime or disable notifications, schedule or disable checks and can acknowledge service problem.

field.name: description
field.string: Service List portlet lists the services and their status. Each Service Name can be selected to drill-down for more detail, and each service problem can be directly acknowledged.

field.name: description
field.string: Service Summary portlet shows monitoring statistics at the Entire Network, Host Group, Service Group and Host levels with drill-down capability for viewing detailed data. These graphs provide an at-a-glance filtered view of your overall service status representing segments of service states.

field.name: description
field.string: Seurat view offers an overall view of a Host Groups Hosts status sortable by Host Name, Status, Last State Change. Along with this, it provides ability to drill down to “host details” by right-clicking on any of the displayed host - where one can have a view of services under that host and can acknowledge problems for that host and services.

field.name: displayName
field.string: Performance Viewer application. Portlet to create views containing local RRD files.

field.name: description
field.string: Custom Group management portlet. A Custom Group is a collection of host group or service group objects at the user interface level, as shown in the Status image to the right. You can also see that the monitor status gets bubbled-up to the top from the host groups and service groups. Custom Groups allow for more freedom to group business functions, locations or infrastructure setup (e.g. workstations, servers, services) and make them more user accessible.

field.name: description
field.string: Network Service Plugin Portlet shows Groundwork Notifications and Installation Information to the user. “Notification Service” needs to be enabled by administrator in order to display various notifications from groundwork. “Build Installation Information” includes information like Installer Name (build version currently installed), Installation Date, etc.

field.name: description
field.string: The Views portlet provides access to NagVis, a visualization add-on for Nagios. NagVis can be used to visualize Nagios Data, e.g. to display IT processes like a mail system or a network infrastructure.

field.name: description
field.string: GroundWork Cloud Hub agent for monitoring virtual environments

field.name: description
field.string: GroundWork Net Hub agent for monitoring software defined networks (SDN)

field.name: description
field.string: NMS Cacti Cacti is a complete RRDtool-based graphing solution. Cacti can be used to collect metric data, especially from network nodes. The GroundWork Monitor Cacti integration module provides thresholding and centralized control of notifications.

field.name: description
field.string: NMS Nedi NeDi uses SNMP and information container in device CDP, CAM and ARP tables to step from device to device. Along the way it identifies any nodes attached to those devices. Device configurations can also be pulled and stored for comparison between executions of NeDi. Changes can be communicated to network administrators. GroundWork Monitor uses data from NeDi to populate the Configuration tool (Monarch) for monitoring using Nagios. Additionally, GroundWork Monitor NMS uses NeDi to support efficient discovery of network devices and nodes.

field.name: displayName
field.string: NMS Weathermap -- Weathermap is a network visualisation tool, to take data you already have and show you an overview of your network in map form.

field.name: description
field.string: NMS ntop -- ntop shows the current network usage. It displays a list of hosts that are currently using the network and reports information concerning the (IP and non-IP) traffic generated and received by each host

field.name: description
field.string: Host Availability displays color-coded status for a selected host. The name of the host and number of services are listed first (e.g. local host (23 Services)), and the colored horizontal bars show the host's availability by status color. The Time selector enables the user to change the present time period for the graph.

field.name: description
field.string: ToDo Gadget, easily manage and track your daily to-do list.

field.name: description
field.string: What date is it? Use this cool calendar to keep track of the date in style. You can switch easily between daily, monthly or yearly view.

field.name: description
field.string: This simple and useful calculator lets you perform most of the basic arithmetic operations.
